reviews.review_msg: Dr. Werth is an excellent professor and really knows her stuff. Her course on utopian and dystopian texts was very insightful. Her lectures are filled with a lot of important information, and the fact that she does not post lecture slides is fine because it makes you pay more attention in class.

Engaging lecturer and is really passionate about the subject even though the readings were really dry and confusing. Doesn't provide much lecture notes on slides, but she addresses a lot of important points in her lectures that doing the readings isn't really necessary.

Tiffany seems very passionate about the subject, but rambles on quite a bit and does not provide enough lecture slides to go along with what she says. TA's do all the marking and the one I had was nice but rather difficult.

I can't say much for his grading as I had a TA mark my work, but his lectures are  fantastic. The final exam was very fair and if you paid attention in lecture (or listened to them online), attended tutorials, and took good notes your should be fine. He has a great late paper policy, though watch out for response papers:  due dates sneak up you!
Hm I guess he's a nice guy.  If it weren't for the random quizzes I don't think I would have gone to lecture, doesn't seem to be too relevant.  Not bad I guess.

Unorganized and repetitive (as has already been stated). Class concept is interesting but I felt like there was really nothing new to learn after the first few weeks. Worthwhile class simply because it is a B-HUM and W course.
Rick is a funny guy that makes things fairly easy for his students. Although the lectures can be repetative, you know what to expect on the exam, and are well prepared for the papers.

I really disliked Didicher's teaching style. She's not a mean/rude person, but I found lectures almost useless. She really likes analysing things from a feminist perspective - so if you don't like that, don't take the course. Marking was okay. Also, sometimes she makes offhand remarks that can be offensive to some groups of people..

This professor was amazing. Very chic and fashion-forward. His lectures are amazingly helpful and being caught up in your readings will do you loads. I really hope I get the chance to be taught by him again.

Best course and professor! I loved the books we read and always looked forward to Budra's lectures. He is entertaining, informative, and very attractive! I would love to take another class with Professor Budra :)

The professor makes or breaks the course, and Budra invigorates English with his clear, insightful knowledge, wit, charisma and humour. Definitely the highlight of my semester, and I'm not an English major. You are only robbing yourself of a wonderful opportunity if you have not taken a class with Budra.

He is very interesting. Attendance is not mandatory since he posts notes and lecture recordings online, but I suggest  you don't ever miss. Class is entertaining! I am a math major, and I always said I hate English. In high school I got 97% in english, but I didn't enjoy it. I am thankful to get my W requirement in a class I enjoyed!

The most amazing prof I've ever had at SFU. He's hilarious, loves his work, and is really helpful if you ask. The most in-depth literary analysis. You can tell he's really smart. He makes the material relatable and understandable. Encourages questions, comments, contributions in class. Read all the novels. Makes apocalyptic literature fun!
Good prof~ EXcellent humor, besrt course ever!!!
one word..EGO! if that doesnt bother you then his teaching makes up for it. lectures are interesting, definetly never a dull moment.

Peter Cramer is an intelligent man but one of the worst lectures I've had. The content could be interesting yet he presents it in a very toned down and dismissive manner. Despite the fact that this class was entitled "Dialogue and Decision Making" there was little dialogue encouraged and when there was he didn't seem to know how to deal with it.
